issue.title: Pyecharts 多个饼图
issue.body:
# Troubleshooting

## Describe your environment
* Operating system:
* Python version:
* Hardware:
* Internet access:
* Jupyter notebook or not? [Y/N]:Y

<!-- Texts appear in angle brackets like this are comments and will not show in your issue body. They are here to help you fill in this form. Feel free to remove those comments. You can also remove other texts that is irrelevant to your issue -->

## Describe your question
Pyecharts 多个饼图，按照http://pyecharts.org/#/zh-cn/charts_base的教学无法成功显示。
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42838093/49519897-0929df00-f8dd-11e8-97fa-15b8fa4556c3.png)
如果我define了Style
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42838093/49519944-2a8acb00-f8dd-11e8-8cee-1414ed7cae88.png)
依然不能成功，请问这里的代码应如何写呢？
Example: I get IOError when running my script to load files.

<!-- Upload screenshot if it helps. Simply drag and drop the image in this editing window. -->

## The minimum code (snippet) to reproduce the issue

import pyecharts
from pyecharts import Pie

pie = Pie('分类浏览中点赞超50的"受欢迎文章"所占的比例', "数据来源：人人都是产品经理", title_pos='center')
Style=[]
style = Style()
pie_style = style.add(label_pos="center", is_label_show=True, label_text_color=None)
pie.add("", ["AI人工智能", ""], [25, 75], center=[15, 30], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["blockchain", ""], [24, 76], center=[30, 30], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["业界动态", ""], [14, 86], center=[45, 30], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["交互体验", ""], [11, 89], center=[60, 30], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["产品经理", ""], [27, 73], center=[75, 30], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["产品运营", ""], [15, 85], center=[90, 30], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["分析评测", ""], [54, 46], center=[15, 75], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["创业学院", ""], [26, 74], center=[30, 75], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["职场攻略", ""], [26, 74], center=[45, 75], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["营销推广", ""], [26, 74], center=[60, 75], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["原型设计", ""], [25, 75], center=[75, 75], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["产品设计", ""], [28, 72], center=[90, 75], radius=[18, 24], legend_top="center", **pie_style)
pie.render()
pie
```python
open('path-to-a-file-not-exist')
```

<!-- If you have big project hard to summarise, please upload it onto GitHub and put link here -->

# Troubleshooting

## Describe your environment

如果我define了Style
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42838093/49519944-2a8acb00-f8dd-11e8-8cee-1414ed7cae88.png)
依然不能成功，请问这里的代码应如何写呢？
Example: I get IOError when running my script to load files.

<!-- Upload screenshot if it helps. Simply drag and drop the image in this editing window. -->

## The minimum code (snippet) to reproduce the issue

import pyecharts
from pyecharts import Pie

pie = Pie('分类浏览中点赞超50的"受欢迎文章"所占的比例', "数据来源：人人都是产品经理", title_pos='center')
Style=[]
style = Style()
pie_style = style.add(label_pos="center", is_label_show=True, label_text_color=None)
pie.add("", ["AI人工智能", ""], [25, 75], center=[15, 30], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["blockchain", ""], [24, 76], center=[30, 30], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["业界动态", ""], [14, 86], center=[45, 30], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["交互体验", ""], [11, 89], center=[60, 30], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["产品经理", ""], [27, 73], center=[75, 30], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["产品运营", ""], [15, 85], center=[90, 30], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["分析评测", ""], [54, 46], center=[15, 75], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["创业学院", ""], [26, 74], center=[30, 75], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["职场攻略", ""], [26, 74], center=[45, 75], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["营销推广", ""], [26, 74], center=[60, 75], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["原型设计", ""], [25, 75], center=[75, 75], radius=[18, 24], **pie_style)
pie.add("", ["产品设计", ""], [28, 72], center=[90, 75], radius=[18, 24], legend_top="center", **pie_style)
pie.render()
pie
```python
open('path-to-a-file-not-exist')
```

issue.title: No error, but the pyecharts map can't display
issue.body:
# Troubleshooting
## Describe your environment
* Operating system:
* Python version:
* Hardware:
* Internet access:
* Jupyter notebook or not? [Y/N]:Y


<!-- Texts appear in angle brackets like this are comments and will not show in your issue body. They are here to help you fill in this form. Feel free to remove those comments. You can also remove other texts that is irrelevant to your issue -->

## Describe your question
No error, but the pyecharts map can't display.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42838093/49517940-58214580-f8d8-11e8-8cec-03eac0df5030.png)
I have already install the maps.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42838093/49518019-8dc62e80-f8d8-11e8-8f6c-b0360d6456e1.png)

## The minimum code (snippet) to reproduce the issue
import pyecharts
from pyecharts import Map
value = [5, 2, 2, 2, 1, 1, 1, 5, 5]
attr = ["深圳", "广州", "杭州", "成都", "南京", "厦门", "武汉", "北京", "上海"]  
map = Map("Map 结合 VisualMap 示例", width=1200, height=600)
map.add(
    "",
    attr,
    value,
    maptype="china",
    is_visualmap=True,
    visual_text_color="#000",
)
map.render()
map
Example:

```python
open('path-to-a-file-not-exist')
```

<!-- If you have big project hard to summarise, please upload it onto GitHub and put link here -->

## Describe the efforts you have spent on this issue

Example:

### Have you Google/ Stackover flow anything?

### Do they solve or partially solve your question?

### What is the closest answer you can find?

forkee.description: The simplist's solution to the mobile-only web story

issue.title: qidian.com - can't scrap the number on the website (special fonts)
issue.body:
# Troubleshooting

## Describe your environment

* Operating system:
* Python version:
* Hardware:
* Internet access:
* Jupyter notebook or not? [Y/N]: Y
* Which chapter of book?:

<!-- Texts appear in angle brackets like this are comments and will not show in your issue body. They are here to help you fill in this form. Feel free to remove those comments. You can also remove other texts that is irrelevant to your issue -->

## Describe your question

I can't scrap the number about how many words the novel have. The url: https://www.qidian.com/all?chanId=2&subCateId=5&size=1&action=0&orderId=&vip=0&month=3&update=1&style=1&pageSize=20&siteid=1&pubflag=0&hiddenField=0&page=1 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42838093/48623037-88657a80-e9e3-11e8-9df9-0bcfd0bbd741.png)

<!-- Upload screenshot if it helps. Simply drag and drop the image in this editing window. -->


## The minimum code (snippet) to reproduce the issue

import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
url = 'https://www.qidian.com/all?chanId=2&subCateId=5&size=1&action=0&orderId=&vip=0&month=3&update=1&style=1&pageSize=20&siteid=1&pubflag=0&hiddenField=0&page=1'
r=requests.get(url)
mypage=BeautifulSoup(r.text)
mypage
import json
json.dumps(a[45].find('span').text)
json.dumps(a[48].find('span').text)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42838093/48623330-530d5c80-e9e4-11e8-9c90-72ad64679933.png)

comment.body: Could you tell me what special modules you used? Thank you!

issue.title: Install Python3 on Windows and Set Environment
issue.body:
1. Click [here](https://www.python.org/ftp/python/3.7.0/python-3.7.0.exe) to download Python 3.7.
2. Remember to choose 'Customize installation' and click 'pip' when you are installing python. If you install the default version, you cannot import 'numpy' module in week2. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42831899/45255308-2111c580-b3b7-11e8-8371-82c3b687956d.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42831899/45255309-253de300-b3b7-11e8-94b8-47f622ece7f9.png)

comment.body: I have tried all the versons above 3.0. None of them work for me. Finally, I found that python 2.7.12 is ok!

issue.title: Install Python3 on Windows and Set Environment
issue.body:
1. Click [here](https://www.python.org/ftp/python/3.7.0/python-3.7.0.exe) to download Python 3.7.
2. Remember to choose 'Customize installation' and click 'pip' when you are installing python. If you install the default version, you cannot import 'numpy' module in week2. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42831899/45255308-2111c580-b3b7-11e8-8371-82c3b687956d.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42831899/45255309-253de300-b3b7-11e8-94b8-47f622ece7f9.png)

comment.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42838093/45354877-6e797700-b5f1-11e8-82b9-efedc36fb953.png)
I was told that windows services pack1 and all applicable updates are required to intall python3.70 (64bit), so i downloaded and installed all the things below.
![_20180911180236](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42838093/45367981-076db980-b615-11e8-9458-df3c6c02dead.png)
However, it still didn't work!
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42838093/45368037-32f0a400-b615-11e8-9a6e-38ad69c0f6b8.png)

issue.title: Install Python3 on Windows and Set Environment
issue.body:
1. Click [here](https://www.python.org/ftp/python/3.7.0/python-3.7.0.exe) to download Python 3.7.
2. Remember to choose 'Customize installation' and click 'pip' when you are installing python. If you install the default version, you cannot import 'numpy' module in week2. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42831899/45255308-2111c580-b3b7-11e8-8371-82c3b687956d.png)
